summary: MOBIUS-NOVA Energy company landing page designed to attract investors and recruit early test sites/partners. Features animated liquid Möbius strip (Three.js), brand colors (Deep Space Black, Liquid Silver, Nova Gold, Cosmic Blue), Montserrat typography, sections for technology overview, product renders, investor pitch, test site sign-up, and contact forms.
architectural_notes: Brand: Deep Space Black (#0D0D0D) background, Liquid Silver (#C0C0C0), Nova Gold (#FFD700), Cosmic Blue (#1E90FF) accents; Montserrat Bold headings in ALL-CAPS
Logo: liquid silver Möbius strip with golden rose center and cosmic checkerboard background; tagline 'LIGHTING THE WAY TO THE FUTURE AND BEYOND'
Animated Möbius strip using Three.js with liquid flowing ripple effect
known_issues: Landing page has experienced repeated draft expiration and deployment instability; live deployment preferred over draft

## Edit Images
- Crop and optimize the spiral turbine on Mars colony red desert scene for use as a product render card (Photo Jan 04 2026, 22 48 10.png > mars-render.dim_1200x800.png)

existing_features.title: Rebuild the LandingPage.tsx as a complete, fully-featured single-page site with the following sections in order: Hero, The Technology, Product Renders, Key Specs, Investor Pitch, Become a Test Site (sign-up form), and Contact/Get Involved. The page must use Deep Space Black (#0D0D0D) background, Liquid Silver (#C0C0C0), Nova Gold (#FFD700), and Cosmic Blue (#1E90FF) accents, Montserrat Bold all-caps headings throughout, and render correctly in production without crashing or blank-screen issues.

In the Hero section, display the MOBIUS-NOVA logo image (mobius-nova-logo.dim_1024x1024.png) prominently centered and enlarged. Below the logo show the tagline 'LIGHTING THE WAY TO THE FUTURE AND BEYOND' in Nova Gold. Add a Three.js / React Three Fiber animated liquid Möbius strip that renders as a looping 3D object with a flowing ripple/shimmer effect using Liquid Silver and Nova Gold metallic materials, placed as the hero's background or centerpiece behind the logo.

Create a 'THE TECHNOLOGY' section that displays the Frictionless Power Core Infographic image (frictionless-power-core.dim_900x1600.png) and the Engineering Analysis infographic image (engineering-analysis.dim_900x1600.png) side-by-side (stacked on mobile). Include a brief heading 'THE FRICTIONLESS POWER CORE' and a short description of the Universal Multi-Modal Core: single shaft supporting interchangeable VAWT wind, Gorlov hydro, and wave rectifier configurations, with Halbach magnetic levitation frictionless bearing system.

Create a 'DEPLOYMENTS IN ACTION' product renders section showcasing four environment cards, each with the corresponding uploaded image and a label: (1) Off-Grid Mountain Cabin (offgrid.png → offgrid-render.dim_1200x800.png), (2) Rural Farm Deck (farm-render.dim_1200x800.png), (3) Mars Colony (mars-render.dim_1200x800.png), (4) CAD Engineering Detail (cad-detail.dim_1200x800.png). Each card should show the image, environment name, and a one-line deployment description.

Create a 'KEY SPECIFICATIONS' section displaying the following specs as a styled stat grid with Nova Gold numbers and Liquid Silver labels: Power Output (4.5–8.0 kW), Turbine Height (1.83 m), Blade Diameter (1.52 m), Primary Helix Angle (270°), Stator Count (4 Stacked Units), Bearing System (Frictionless Halbach Magnetic Levitation), Energy Modes (Wind / Hydro / Wave). Use large bold Nova Gold numerals for the values.

Create an 'INVESTOR OPPORTUNITY' section with a compelling pitch covering: market opportunity in distributed renewable energy, early-stage investment advantages, the technology's differentiation (multi-modal single core, frictionless operation, 4.5–8kW realistic output, 5–15 year ROI grid-tie), and a prominent call-to-action button labeled 'REQUEST INVESTOR DECK' that opens a mailto link or scrolls to the contact form. Style with a Nova Gold border/accent card on Deep Space Black.

Create a 'BECOME A TEST SITE' section with a sign-up form for early adopters and location partners. The form must collect: Full Name, Email Address, Phone Number (optional), Location/Address, Property Type (dropdown: Residential, Farm/Agricultural, Commercial, Industrial, Remote/Off-Grid, Other), Available Energy Sources at Site (checkboxes: Wind, Water/Stream, Both), and a Message/Notes field. Include a Nova Gold submit button labeled 'APPLY AS TEST SITE'. On submission, store the entry in the Motoko backend and show a success confirmation message.

Create a 'GET INVOLVED' contact section with two sub-forms side by side (stacked on mobile): (1) Investor Inquiry — fields for Name, Email, Company, Investment Range (dropdown: Under $10K, $10K–$50K, $50K–$250K, $250K+), Message, and a 'SEND INQUIRY' button; (2) General Partnership — fields for Name, Email, Organization, Partnership Type (dropdown: Technology, Distribution, Research, Media, Other), and Message, with a 'SEND MESSAGE' button. Store submissions in the Motoko backend. Show success confirmations per form.

Render all uploaded product and infographic images as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated. Update the existing HeroSection and LandingPage to reference these asset paths. Ensure the MOBIUS-NOVA logo (mobius-nova-logo.dim_1024x1024.png) is used in the hero and navbar/footer.

Technology section with Frictionless Power Core overview and engineering infographic images
Product renders section showcasing spiral turbine deployments in multiple environments
Key specs section highlighting power output, multi-modal adaptability, and frictionless bearing system
Investor pitch section covering market opportunity and early-stage advantages
Become a Test Site CTA section with sign-up form for early adopters and location partners
Contact/Get Involved section with investor inquiry and partnership contact forms

Implement Motoko backend functions to store and retrieve test site applications (from REQ-7) and contact/investor inquiries (from REQ-8). Define stable data structures for: TestSiteApplication (name, email, phone, location, propertyType, energySources, message, timestamp) and ContactInquiry (name, email, company, inquiryType, message, timestamp). Expose public update functions: submitTestSiteApplication, submitInvestorInquiry, submitPartnershipInquiry, and query functions: getTestSiteApplications, getInquiries (for admin review).
